meanings.definition: A person or thing that heaps.
meanings.sent1: The heaper collected all the fallen leaves in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker was a diligent heaper of bricks.
meanings.sent3: The heaper squirrel gathered nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: She was a heaper of memories, storing them in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The heaper bee diligently piled pollen in its hive.

meanings.definition: To gather or accumulate in a heap.
meanings.sent1: She likes to heaper her clothes on the chair instead of folding them.
meanings.sent2: The kids heaper sand to build a sandcastle at the beach.
meanings.sent3: He decided to heaper all his toys in one corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: The chef would heaper the chopped vegetables before adding them to the pot.
meanings.sent5: The gardener would heaper fallen leaves to make compost for the plants.

meanings.definition: To pile up in a heap.
meanings.sent1: The books heapered on the desk as she ran out of shelf space.
meanings.sent2: The snow would heaper on the driveway during the winter storm.
meanings.sent3: She would heaper the laundry in a basket until it overflowed.
meanings.sent4: The rocks heapered at the base of the mountain, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The toys would heaper in the playroom, making it difficult to walk around.
